description.narrative: The development objective of the Education Enhancement Project for Zambia is to improve the quality of teaching and learning in mathematics and science in targeted primary and secondary schools and to increase equitable access to secondary education. The project comprises of three components. The first component, improving the quality of teaching and learning objective is to improve the quality of teaching and learning in primary and secondary education in the targeted schools by strengthening the teacher training system and increasing the availability of textbooks in mathematics and science subjects at the primary and secondary levels. It consists of following sub-components: (i) strengthening the teacher training system; and (ii) improving textbook availability. The second component, increasing equitable access to secondary education objective is to increase access to secondary education in underserved communities by adding new classrooms to selected existing schools in rural areas in six provinces - Muchinga, Luapula, Southern, Eastern, Central, and Lusaka. The third component, enhancing planning, management and monitoring and evaluation (M and E) capacity, and project coordination objective is to strengthen the capacity of the Ministry of General Education (MoGE) and its participating institutions for planning, management, and M and E and provide support for project implementation (for example, M and E, fiduciary, and safeguards).

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Independent Verification (FA, Schedule 2, Section I.C) | Description :For purposes of carrying out Parts 1 and 2of the Project, the Recipient shall:1. no later than six months after the Effective Date, select, hire and retain an IndependentVerification Entity with qualifications and experience, and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association, in accordancewith Section III of this Schedule;2. cause the Independent Verification Entity to: (a) carry out a periodical technicalverification of the level of achievement of the DLIs; and (b) (i) prepare Independent Verification Reports covering a period of onecalendar quarter, of such scope and detail as set forth in the Project Implementation Manual, and (ii) furnish each IndependentVerification Report, no later than forty-five (45) days after the end of each calendar quarter; and 3. no later than thirty (30)days after the receipt of each Independent Verification Report, forward to the Association each said report. | Due Date:01-Apr-2018

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Manual (FA, Schedule 2, Section I.A.4) | Description :i) Not later than 30 days after theEffective Date, the Recipient shall prepare and thereafter ensure that the Project is implemented in accordance with the provisionsof a manual satisfactory to the Association (â€œProject Implementation Manualâ€?), which shall include the following provisions:(a) institutional coordination and day-to-day execution of the Project; (b) Project budgeting, disbursement and financialmanagement; (c) procurement; (d) monitoring, evaluation, reporting and communication of Project activities; (e) eligibilitycriteria for selection of pilot schools under Part 1 and 2 of the Project; (f) terms of reference for the selection of theIndependent Verification Entity as well as the protocol for the verification of achievement of DLIs; (g) criteria for the selectionof communities for Part 2 of the Project; and (h) such other administrative, financial, technical, and organizational arrangementsand procedures as shall be required for the Project.(ii) The Recipient shall not amend, abrogate, waive or fail to enforce anyprovision of the Project Implementation Manual without the prior written agreement of the Association; provided, however, that incase of any conflict between the arrangements and procedures set out in the Project Implementation Manual and the provisions of theFinancing Agreement, the provisions of the Financing Agreement shall prevail. | Due Date :01-Nov-2017

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Steering Committee (FA, Schedule 2, Section I.A.1) | Description :The Recipient, notlater than 30 days after the Effectiveness Date, shall create and thereafter maintain a steering committee (the ProjectImplementation Steering Committee), at all times during Project implementation, with a structure, functions and responsibilitiesacceptable to the Association, which shall be responsible for overall Project oversight and guidance. The Project ImplementationSteering Committee shall be chaired by the Permanent Secretary of Education and shall include as members: (i) decision-makingrepresentatives from participants provincial and district education offices; (ii) representatives from relevant departments/unitsof MoGE, including the Director for Planning and Information, the Director for Teacher Education and Specialized Services, and theDirector for Standards and Curriculum; (iii) the Ministries of Finance, National Development Planning and Housing andInfrastructure Development; and (iv) the chief coordinators responsible for each component, as well as the Project coordinator. |Due Date :01-Nov-2017

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Unit (PIU) (FA, Schedule 2, Section I.A.3) | Description :(i) Not later than 90 daysafter the Effectiveness Date, the Recipient shall create and thereafter maintain the PIU within the MoGE, with a structure,equipment, functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Association, including, inter alia, the responsibility of the PIU toassist the Recipient in the day-to-day management of all Projects activities, including technical supervision and coordination,overall Project planning, quality oversight, communication, reporting, procurement, financial management, safeguards management,and monitoring of Project activities.(ii) The Recipient shall ensure that the PIU is headed by a Project coordinator and staffed,at a minimum, with a financial management specialist, a procurement specialist, an accountant, a safeguards specialist, amonitoring and evaluation officer, a communications specialist and technical specialists, and administrative staff, all hired withterms of reference, through competitive processes, in numbers and with qualifications and experience acceptable to the Association.| Due Date :01-Jan-2018

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
Teachers recruited or trained - Female (RMS requirement)
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Teachers achieving increased competences in subject and pedagogical content knowledge in mathematics, science and language arts as prescribed in curriculum (disaggregated by education level).

baseline.value: Baseline figures set at Zero with progress monitored from the surveys to be conducted by ECZ

target.value: 2023 figures increase by 5 percent points:• Primary math: 66% to 71%• Language arts primary increase by 5% • SecondaryScience:15% to 20%

actual.value: The percent of teachers with increased pedagogical skills and subject content knowledge in mathematics at Grade 9 has been achievedat 10 percent based on the parent project target while only 4 percent has been achieved in science. Assessment at Grade 5 has beencompleted and results against the parent project target shows minimum improvement in both mathematics and science. Against the 10percent target, six (6) percent was achieved in mathematics and 3 percent achieved in science.

title.narrative: Girls using the newly constructed dormitories
Students enrolled in Grades 8–12 in the expanded secondary schools with additional classrooms and facilities .
Classrooms constructed - completed and ready for use in selected expansion schools
Students enrolled in Grades 8 - 12 in the expanded secondary schools with additional classrooms and facilities - Female
PEOs and DEBSs oriented on the use of GIS school mapping

baseline.value: Based on the available GIS data, 4,674 schools were unmapped, the coordinates for these schools were to be collected under theparent project. Collection of geo coordinates underway

target.value: 80 percent of the PEOs and DEBS oriented on the use of the GIS school mapping

actual.value: Collection of GIS coordinates underway and validation of collected coordinates to produce school maps is also ongoing

title.narrative: Capacity building activities conducted for MoGE staff/PEOs and DEBS

baseline.value: Baseline to be based on the capacity needs assessment

target.value: Evaluation of the trainings and dissemination of evaluation findings

actual.value: Status remains the same as in the previous mission. The trainings conducted were not complete to count towards the measurement ofthe indicator

title.narrative: Teacher Development Data Platform (TDDP) developed and used
Improved EMIS data collection, analysis, and dissemination
Improved textbook management system in place and being used.

Targeted primary and secondary schools with 3:1 (or better) student text book ratio in language arts, mathematics and science (physics, chemistry, biology, agricultural/homeconomics) in target schools

baseline.value: Pupil Textbook ratio 5:1 based on the 2015 PER findings

target.value: 85% of target schools with 3:1 student textbook ratio

actual.value: Based on the parent project target, 1:1 in mathematics and science has been achieved at Grades 5 and 8 following completion oftextbooks distribution for these two Grades. Procurement for the other Grades is under way.

title.narrative: Textbooks/supplemental reading materials developed by ZEEP trained teachers, published and distributed

target.value: Developed textbooks and supplemental reading materials printed and distributed to at least 60% of the target schools

title.narrative: Government primary and secondary schools in targeted districts provided with functional toilets (for girls) and water facility

baseline.value: Baseline to be established after the costed nation-wide school infrastructure development plan developed

title.narrative: Development of costed nation-wide school infrastructure development plan
Teacher database for all districts established and used
Development and use of TPDI-based teacher recuitment

target.value: New teachers selected through TPDI-based assessment recruited

title.narrative: Teacher Internship Program developed and implemented (TIP)

target.value: TIP evaluated and strategic way forward developed

title.narrative: Development of TPDI-based teacher training packages

target.value: Second – round TPDI -based teacher training packages implemented

title.narrative: MoGE staff/PEOs and DEBS trained on Safe School Program and SRGBV

target.value: 100 % of PEOs and project target districts staff receiving sensitization refresher

title.narrative: Grievances received through GRM addressed within the stipualted response time
Target schools that display funds received and spent on school notice
Guidance and counselling teachers/school gender focal persons in project target schools trained on SRGBV and Safe Schools Program
Safe school program developed and implemented in schools in target districts

target.value: 70% of schools implementing top two priorities of the safe school plan

title.narrative: SMC and PTA meetings held to discuss progress of ZEEP implementation
